titles.title: Long Have I Sought For Happiness

properties.verseOrder: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6 v7 v8

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Long have I sought for happiness, But where can it be found? Only, dear Saviour in Thy grace, Where purest joys abound.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v2
v3
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Lord, if a transient sight of Thee Affords us such a feast, How glorious will that vision be, Which shall forever last?{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: {lang-eng}When shall we, Lord, Thy glory see In light without a shade, The glort which surrounded Thee Before the world was made?{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: {lang-eng}What cares, infirmities and pains Oppress our feeble frame? Immortal health and vigor reigns In presence if the Lamb.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v6
v7
v8
verse.lines: {lang-eng}The world shall no more charm eyes, Nor captive our hearts, Our soluls to nobler pleasures rise, Which God Himself imparts.{/lang-eng}
